text.citation: Rau, D. V., & Dong, M. N. (2006). Yami texts with reference grammar and dictionary. Institute of Linguistics, Academia Sinica.
text.BibTeX_citation: @book{rau2006yami, title={Yami texts with reference grammar and dictionary}, author={Rau, D Victoria and Dong, Maa-Neu}, year={2006}, publisher={Institute of Linguistics, Academia Sinica}}
text.source: ['11. Akay, mi namen rana an!', '阿公，再見！', 'Bye, Grandpa!', '', 'si apen Yohani (F, 49, Iranmilek)', '江秀玉，女，49，東清村', '']

S.FORM: ya na ika-doa no ya ko i-panci a ami-amizing ko a kava-kavavatanen da nokakoa noka-k-anak-an, am siciaikoa rana ya ori,
S.TRANSL: 我要講的第二個故事是，他們小時候的故事。但這是近幾年才聽到的故事
The second story that I’m going to tell is about their childhood. I have only heard about it recently.

S.FORM: ra-roa ka k-anak-an o mi-av-avang do aarang ito am, to da ngao-kaod-a o tatala da ori am,
S.TRANSL: 有兩個小孩子在那裡的海上遊船，他們划著船，划呀划的
Two children were rowing a boat in the sea. They kept rowing a boat there.

S.FORM: ma-níring o asa ka ra-rakeh a ma-masil ori am,
S.TRANSL: 那個釣魚的老人說
The old man who was fishing said,

S.FORM: “manga koinio! síjia kamo pala” koan na sira o ra-roa mi-av-avang a do tatala ori am.
S.TRANSL: “喂，你們過來！” 那老人喊叫那兩個在遊船的小孩說
“Hey, come here!” yelled he to the two boys.

S.FORM: “manga koinio! síjia kamo pala an” koan na am, “neda, o ito so ya manci niaten a ra-rakeh a, mi ta pala jia ori an”, “nohon”.
S.TRANSL: “喂，你們過來看看！” 他說，“是嗎，你看那個老人在叫我們呢，我們過去看看好不好？” “好啊”
“Come here for a minute.” “Hey, the old man is calling us, so why don’t we go check it out?” “Okay.”

S.FORM: “na, inio rana manga koinio am, pa-sngen kamo jia o tatala nio,
S.TRANSL: “這樣吧，小朋友，你們把船靠過來
“How about this, little children? Could you row closer to me?

S.FORM: a ka-pa-zagpit nio jiaken, ta mi tamo do Jiahaod a ma-masil manga koinio an” koan na no ra-rakeh a.
S.TRANSL: 然後載我，我們一起去Jiahaod釣魚好不好？” 老人說
Let me get on the boat, so we can go fishing together at Jiahaod,” said the old man.

S.FORM: ma-níring o ra-roa ka k-anak-an ori am, “ay, oyod a ma-ngay namen do Jiahaod a”,
S.TRANSL: 兩個小孩子說，“噯，真的！我們真的要去Jiahaod”
“Oh, really? Are we really going to Jiahaod?” the two kids said.

S.FORM: “nohon a, ma-ngay tamo do Jiahaod ori, ma-závak do Jiahaod ori a ji mi-alalam-i a namen pa ji ni-angay-an ang” koan da am, ma-ngay rana sira.
S.TRANSL: “好啊，我們去Jiahaod，能去Jiahaod玩真是太棒了，況且我們還沒去過那裡” 他們說，於是他們去了Jiahaod
“Okay, let’s go to Jiahaod. It’s an unusual place to go. We haven’t been there before,” so they rowed toward Jiahaod.

S.FORM: karaan am, ikongdo 國小二,三年級 sira ori o k-anak-an a, nona ali-likey pa sira ori am,
S.TRANSL: 由於他們年紀都還小，才國小二、三年級的小孩子
The kids were young, only second or third grade,

S.FORM: ma-ságpaw o ra-rakeh ori a kaod-en da, am ori to da mi-sing-singíc-i no ra-roa ka k-anak-an ori a k-om-aod sia,
S.TRANSL: 那老人家實在很重，重得讓他們划起來感到非常的吃力與辛苦，他們累的都快要哭了
and the old man was really heavy, so they were rowing very hard. The two kids were so tired of rowing that they were about to cry.

W.TRANSL: 虛.動綴-疊-要哭要哭的情形-處焦.虛

S.FORM: ta (nakm-en da) pa-’okso-en do wawa am, k-asi da nia a.
S.TRANSL: 他們實在很想把他推到海上去，卻又不忍心這樣待他
They really wanted to toss him into the sea, but they couldn’t do that.

S.FORM: karaan am, maka-sasnad rana sira do Jiahaod ori am, to da rana i pa-zomtád-a do dang a.
S.TRANSL: 終於他們抵達了Jiahaod，並讓老人家下船
Once they got to Jiahaod, they let the old man off.

S.FORM: ra-roa ni-mi-k-avang do tatala ori am, “key! ma-ngay ta rana, ta ngazicin si mi maci-zagpit jiaten am, ya ji ma-ngaod, a ya ta rana ka-zikna-en a ya ma-ngaod am,
S.TRANSL: 至於划雙人船的那兩個小孩子，說“快，我們快走！不然他又來搭我們船，坐船也不划船，害我們划得累死了，討厭死了
Once they did that, the two kids said, “Quick, let’s go, or else the moron will get on, and once on he won’t row. We’re totally tired out.”

S.FORM: na ji ngaod-a yaten a, ta kaod-en, key! mi ta rana” koan da.
S.TRANSL: 他不幫我們划船，反而讓我們划船載他。快！我們走了” 他們說
“He didn’t help row. We wound up doing all the rowing. Let’s go!” they said.

S.FORM: ma-cita na sira no ra-rakeh ori am, “manga koinio, kanio rana toda angay a, nio rana ji nga-hap-a yaken manga koinio a,”
S.TRANSL: 老人看見他們走了，就說“喂，你們怎麼就這麼走了？不載我了嗎？喂，你們 ”
As soon as the old man saw them leaving, he said, “Hey, why are you leaving? What about me?”

S.FORM: “manga koinio, nio rana ji nga-hap-a yaken manga koinio a, ma-kong ko so wajin a, m-awat ko pa manga koinio do k-aci-an ang, hap-ey kamo pa yaken manga koinio!”.
S.TRANSL: “喂，小鬼，你們怎麼不載我了？你們要我怎麼辦？島上那麼遠，我怎麼游得到？你們快來載我！”
“You brats, why aren’t you waiting for me? What about me? The island is so far away. How will I swim back? Come back!”

S.FORM: ji da ngamizing-a no ra-roa ori a, “saon jimo am, mo todey rara-i jiamen, a om-avang nimo do Jiahaod”
S.TRANSL: 他們才不聽呢，“你活該，誰叫你讓我們把你載去Jiahaod”
The two brats didn’t listen. “Your own fault! It was you who summoned us to take you to Jiahaod”

S.FORM: “cig! y-avang namen imo, mo ji a-ka-pi-aw-awat” koan da ori am, ji da rana ni-m要理-i sia ori a.
S.TRANSL: 他們說“叱，想要我們載？你不會自己游啊！” 因此他們就沒有管他了
“Jeez, you want us to take you? Can’t you swim?” They ignored him.

W.TRANSL: 靜態.虛-動綴-動綴-疊-游泳

S.FORM: “manga koinio! mipa-nngó-nngo ko ya manga koinio a, m-awat ko pa do k-aci-an ori manga takzes a,
S.TRANSL: “喂，小鬼，我怎麼辦？島上這麼遠，我怎麼游得到啊，小鬼，真可惡！
“Hey, brats, what about me? The island is so far, how am I going to swim there? Fucking brats!”

S.FORM: ásio kamo ya, tey-má-ra-rahet so i-yangay ori manga peyaavoada, nio rana ji ngap-a yaken a, nio rana todey pa-bhes-a yaken do jia ya, manga peyaavoada!” koan na.
S.TRANSL: 你們真的很壞呢，居然把我丟在這裡就不載回去了，真是的！
“You guys are morons leaving me here. Fuck!”

S.FORM: am-ian rana sira do aarang o ra-roa ka k-anak-an ori am, “tes na ori! ta apia pa jia ori, ta na ka-tey-mákey a ma-ngay do Jiahaod, síno ori o ma-hap sia ang” koan da,
S.TRANSL: 小孩子回到岸上以後，就說“他活該，誰叫他那麼愛去Jiahaod釣魚，誰要去載他回來啊” 他們說
When the kids got back, they said, “It’s his own fault. He’s the one who wanted to fish on Jiahaod. Who said we had to bring him back?”

S.FORM: am ji da rana ni-mi-ma-hap-i so ra-rakeh ori, ta to sia rana mi-yo-yówyaw do ili ori a.
S.TRANSL: 所以他們就沒有再去載回那個老人家，就在村莊遊逛去了
The two kids didn’t even go back to get the old man but went to play in the village.

W.TRANSL: 過去-動綴-動綴-拿-處焦.虛

S.FORM: ra-rakeh rana ori am, a koannata, ji rana maka-rala?
S.TRANSL: 致於那個老人呢，當然還是要回島上來啊
As for the old man, of course he had to return.

S.FORM: m-onay am, nak-nákm-en na rana o ka-ji da rana i nga-hap-an sia am, to rana mi-aw-áwat rana ori a ma-ngay do k-aci-an a, ka-pandan na rana no nang a.
S.TRANSL: 後來，他看他們不再來載回他，他就只好自己游回本島了，游得他累得半死
When he saw they weren’t coming back, he swam. It tired him out completely.

S.FORM: k-adadáy-an na so aw-awan am, ma-mareng so kanen do asa ka aviik, ori rana.
S.TRANSL: 過了幾年以後，（想到自己很辛苦且還能活命游回島上）就殺了一頭豬慰勞自己。就說到這裡
After a few years, he thought of how hard it was to get back, so he killed a pig to congratulate himself.

S.FORM: ratateng am, to sia na angay do, to da pa-laód-a do Jimaramay ori am, to da á-cita o ma-masil a asa ka ra-rakeh ori a.
S.TRANSL: 他們就划船到 ，愈划愈遠，後來就划到了Jimaramay，在那裡遇到一位正在釣魚的老人
They went farther and farther. When they got to Jimalamay, they met an old man who was fishing.

S.FORM: avek da nira k-om-aod sia.
S.TRANSL: 而他們則使勁的划船離他而去
They kept rowing hard (to run away from him).
